intro: Viguiera peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian ironweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It produces small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer and early fall. Viguiera peruviana is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
